title: Life Expectancy in USSR and Russia

content.question: Which of the following accurately describes a trend shown in the chart?

choices.label: Life expectancy steadily rose in the Soviet Union under the leadership of Mikhail Gorbachev (1985–1991).
Life expectancy was consistently lower under the Soviet Union (1922–1991) than it was under the Russian Federation from 1991 to 2017.
Life expectancy consistently rose once Vladimir Putin became president of the Soviet Union in 2000.
When Vladimir Putin became president in 2000, life expectancy was declining.

content.answer: When Vladimir Putin became president in 2000, life expectancy was declining.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Describe patterns and trends in data.
